monitors.customTitle: Policy Brownfield Alert:  High latency for checkPolicyCompliance operations in [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] in 15M
monitors.description:
Alerts on high latency in Microsoft.Resources/checkPolicyCompliance operations

bpannell (2020-06-15): Moved to the Role-ResourceProviders health model

customLinks.query:
HttpIncomingRequests
| where TIMESTAMP > ago(6h)
| where SourceNamespace contains replace(@"\s+|est$|orth$|ast$|outh$|entral$", "", "{Monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}") and SourceNamespace startswith strcat("csm", extract(@"^(\w+)", 1, "{Monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}")) and SourceNamespace endswith strcat(extract(@"(\d+)$", 1, "{Monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}"), "RPF")
| where operationName in (
    "GET/SUBSCRIPTIONS/RESOURCES",
    "GET/SUBSCRIPTIONS",
    "GET/SUBSCRIPTIONS/RESOURCEGROUPS"
)
| summarize (P50,P90,P99) = percentiles(durationInMilliseconds, 50, 90, 99) by bin(TIMESTAMP, 2m)
| render timechart
customLinks.title: Endpoint Latency

customLinks.query:
HttpIncomingRequests
| where TIMESTAMP > make_datetime("{Monitor.StartTime}")
| where SourceNamespace contains replace(@"\s+|est$|orth$|ast$|outh$|entral$", "", "{Monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}") and SourceNamespace startswith strcat("csm", extract(@"^(\w+)", 1, "{Monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}")) and SourceNamespace endswith strcat(extract(@"(\d+)$", 1, "{Monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}"), "RPF")
| where operationName in (
    "GET/SUBSCRIPTIONS/RESOURCES",
    "GET/SUBSCRIPTIONS",
    "GET/SUBSCRIPTIONS/RESOURCEGROUPS"
)
| where durationInMilliseconds > 5000
| distinct subscriptionId
customLinks.title: Impacted Subscriptions

monitors.customMessage: This monitor will trigger when the time taken to respond to common Portal queries exceeds the acceptable user experience thresholds set for ARM. When this monitor fires it indicates that a region is no longer able to serve customer requests in a timely fashion and that there is visible customer impact. Please engage CXP/Comms and communicate this to affected customers while taking steps to mitigate the problem (scale out etc).
monitors.customTitle: Customers making requests to ARM in [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] are experiencing increased response latencies
monitors.description: This monitor will trigger when the time taken to respond to common Portal queries exceeds the acceptable user experience thresholds set for ARM. When this monitor fires it indicates that a region is no longer able to serve customer requests in a timely fashion and that there is visible customer impact. Please engage CXP/Comms and communicate this to affected customers while taking steps to mitigate the problem (scale out etc).

metadata.metadataValue: Please use the Troubleshooting Dashboard link provided in the ICM ticket to identify the cause of this incident and next steps for mitigation.

conditions: France Central,Japan West,Korea Central,Central India,Germany North,Korea South,UK South,UAE North,Australia Central
monitors.customMessage: This region is currently receiving less incoming traffic than expected. Perhaps this region has been taken out of rotation deliberately, in which case the monitor should be suppressed for a time. Perhaps we are currently performing a deployment to this region which replaces the Cloud Service. If neither of these scenarios applies, then there may be something seriously wrong and this should be urgently investigated.
monitors.customTitle: Frontdoor region [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] out of rotation or getting low traffic.
monitors.description:
This monitor alerts when a region appears to be receiving traffic significantly below expected levels.
bpannell (2020-06-12) - Marked the failing monitor as a "degraded" health indicator (as it indicates a reduction in service, not necessarily a failure)

This is the "low traffic" monitor, which has a trigger threshold set for production regions which receive relatively low traffic, but more than the "baseline" monitor. Eligible regions should be opted into this monitor by adding them to the list of regions in "Data Source" below.

2020-02-17 (nst): Removing "UK North" from the list of regions for this monitor as it has been manually removed from Traffic Manager for decommissioning.

monitors.customMessage: This region is currently receiving less incoming traffic than expected. Perhaps this region has been taken out of rotation deliberately, in which case the monitor should be suppressed for a time. Perhaps we are currently performing a deployment to this region which replaces the Cloud Service. If neither of these scenarios applies, then there may be something seriously wrong and this should be urgently investigated.
monitors.customTitle: Frontdoor region [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] out of rotation or getting low traffic.
monitors.description:
This monitor alerts when a region appears to be receiving traffic significantly below expected levels. 

This is the "baseline" monitor, which has the lowest trigger threshold for all the monitors of this type, and should apply to all regions (except possibly regions that are *currently* being built out).

2020-06-25 (nst): Dropped threshold to <5000 requests per hour to account for lower canary traffic after decommissioning runners.
2020-06-12 (bpannell): Marked the failing monitor as a "degraded" health indicator (as it indicates a reduction in service, not necessarily a failure)
2020-06-07 (ramoka): Excluded Brazil Southeast

customLinks.query:
HttpIncomingRequests
| where TIMESTAMP >= datetime({monitor.DataStartTime}) and TIMESTAMP <= datetime({monitor.DataEndTime})
| where operationName == "{monitor.Dimension.OperationName}" and Role == "{monitor.Dimension.__Role}"
customLinks.title: Greenfield CRUD Requests

monitors.customTitle: Policy CRUD Alert:  High latency for CRUD operations in [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] in 15M, Operation  [{monitor.Dimension.OperationName}]
monitors.description: Alerts on high latency in policy resource CRUD operations

monitors.customMessage: This region is currently getting very low traffic. The possibility is that this region has been taken out of rotation and have been missed to be put back. If this is not the case, then there is something wrong with the incoming traffic to this region. This alert is intentionally put to catch issues where in out of rotation regions are put back in.
monitors.customTitle: Shim region [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] out of rotation or getting low traffic.
monitors.description: bpannell (2020-06-18): Changed the monitored region to North Central US since that is the currently configured Shim region.

conditions: South Africa West,Switzerland West,Switzerland North,UAE Central,Norway West,Norway East,Brazil US,South Africa North

When this monitor fires it indicates that a region is no longer able to serve customer requests in a timely fashion and that there is visible customer impact. monitors.customTitle: Portal users making requests to ARM in [{Monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] are experiencing significant latency on basic ARM requests
monitors.description: This monitor will trigger when the time taken to respond to common Portal queries exceeds the acceptable user experience thresholds set for ARM. When this monitor fires it indicates that a region is no longer able to serve customer requests in a timely fashion and that there is visible customer impact. Please engage CXP/Comms and communicate this to affected customers while taking steps to mitigate the problem (scale out etc).

metadata.metadataValue: Please use the Troubleshooting Dashboard link provided in the ICM ticket to identify the cause of this incident and next steps for mitigation.

customLinks.query:
HttpIncomingRequests
| where TIMESTAMP > datetime({StartTimeScrubbed}) and TIMESTAMP < datetime({EndTimeScrubbed})
| where httpStatusCode >= 500
| take 100
customLinks.title: Kusto query

monitors.customTitle: Customers making requests to Microsoft.Solutions in [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] are experiencing a high number of 5xx errors
monitors.description:
11/7/2019 -sanjaiga- Excluded -1 and made it sev 2. Revisit to increase threshold to 5% if firing too frequently.. 

bpannell (2020-06-18) Aggregated all operations into a single alert metric and moved this to the testing health model until it can be un-silenced

monitors.customTitle: Frontdoor region [{monitor.Dimension.RoleLocation}] out of rotation or getting low traffic.
monitors.description:
This monitor alerts when a region appears to be receiving traffic significantly below expected levels. 
bpannell (2020-06-12) - Marked the failing monitor as a "degraded" health indicator (as it indicates a reduction in service, not necessarily a failure)

This is the "medium traffic" monitor, which has a trigger threshold set for production regions which receive middling traffic levels. Eligible regions should be opted into this monitor by adding them to the list of regions in "Data Source" below.

2020-02-17 (nst): Removing "UK South 2" from the list of regions for this monitor as it has been manually removed from Traffic Manager for decommissioning.

monitors.description:
This monitor alerts when a region appears to be receiving traffic significantly below expected levels. 
bpannell (2020-06-12) - Marked the failing monitor as a "degraded" health indicator (as it indicates a reduction in service, not necessarily a failure)
